BiblioData.Title: METHOD FOR DEPOSITING HIGH ASPECT RATIO MOLECULAR STRUCTURES
BiblioData.Abstract: A method for depositing high aspect ratio molecular structures (HARMS), which method comprises applying a force upon an aerosol comprising one or more HARM-structures, which force moves one or more HARM-structures based on one or more physical features and/or properties towards one or more predetermined locations for depositing one or more HARM-structures in a pattern by means of an applied force.

Claims.P: CLAIMS

1. A method for depositing high aspect ratio molecular structures (HARMS) , charact eri sed in that the method comprises applying a force upon an aerosol comprising one or more HARM-structures, which force moves one or more HARM-structures based on one or more physical features and/or properties towards one or more predetermined locations for depositing one or more HARM-structures in a pattern by means of an applied force.
2. A method according to claim 1, characteri sed in that the force is applied upon one or more bundled HARM-structures .
3. A method according to claim 1, characteri sed in that the force is applied upon one or more individual HARM-structures .

4. A method according to claim 1, characteri s ed in that the force is applied upon one or more bundled and individual HARM- structures, wherein the force moves the bundled and/or the individual HARM-structure based on one or more physical features and/or properties.
5. A method according to any of claims 1 - 4, characteri s ed in that bundled or individual HARM-structure is deposited.
6. A method according to any of claims 1 - 4 , charac teri s ed in that bundled and individual HARM-structures are deposited.

7. A method according to any of claims 1 - 6, characteri sed in that the HARM-structure comprises a nanotube, a carbon nanotube, a fullerene functionalized carbon nanotube, a boron-nitride nanotube, a nanorod including carbon, phosphorous, boron, nitrogen and/or silicon containing nanorod, a filament and/or any other tube, tubular, rod and/or ribbon and/or any other high aspect ratio molecular structure in individual or bundled form.
8. A method according to any of claims 1 - 7, charact eri sed in that a HARM-structure is positively, negatively or neutrally charged.

9. A method according to any of claims 1 - 8, charact eri s ed in that the force comprises an electrical, an electrostatic, a magnetic, an inertial, a photophoretic, a thermophoretic, a gravitational, a viscous and/or an acoustic force.
10. A method according to any of claims 1 -
9, characteri sed in that the force comprises an electrical force moving a naturally charged bundled HARM-structure.
11. A method according to any of claims 1 -
10, characteri s ed in that the force comprises an inertial force moving a bundled HARM-structure .
12. A method according to any of claim 1 -

11, characteri sed in that the method further comprises adding one or more reactants, agents, coating materials, functionalizing materials, surfactants and/or dopants to the one or more HARM- structures .

13. The use of a method according to any of claims 1 - 12 in a continuous or batch process for the production, separation, modification, deposition and/or further processing of one or more HARM- structures .
14. The use of a method according to any of claims 1 - 12 in the preparation of a functional material .
15. The use of a method according to any of claims 1 - 12 in the preparation of a thick or thin film, a line, a wire, a pattern, a layered and/or three dimensional structure.
16. The use of a method according to any of claims 1 - 12 in the preparation of a device.
